Package me.talkcode.acc.core

Interface AccountingContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractContext
public interface AccountingContext
The context in which all accounting operations take place. All accounting records are about an Organization. There can be multiple contexts in the system, but there can only be one active context in a Thread at a time. There can only be one active AccountingPeriod in the context.

  • Method Details

    • getOrganization

      Organization getOrganization()
      Gets the Organization of which the accounting is all about.
      Returns:
      the Organization of which the accounting is all about

    • currentPeriod

      AccountingPeriod currentPeriod() throws NoActivePeriodException
      Gets the current AccountingPeriod
      Returns:
      the active AccountingPeriod.
      Throws:
      NoActivePeriodException - whenever there is no active AccountingPeriod.

    • listPeriods

      Set<AccountingPeriod> listPeriods()
      Gets the AccountingPeriods available. The available AccountingPeriods is a subset of all AccountingPeriods created in the context.
      Returns:
      the AccountingPeriods available.

    • newPeriod

      AccountingPeriod newPeriod(LocalDate start, LocalDate end)
      Starts a new AccountingPeriod using the default accounting Scheme.
      Parameters:
      start - the AccountingPeriod start date. Can be any date as long as it is before the end date.
      end - the AccountingPeriod start date. Can be any date as long as it is after the start date.
      Returns:
      the initiated AccountingPeriod
      Throws:
      AccountingViolationException - when the end date is before the start date
      AccountingException - when there is no default accounting Scheme set
      ConcurrentPeriodException - when attempting to start a new AccountingPeriod when there is another active.

    • newPeriod

      AccountingPeriod newPeriod(LocalDate start, LocalDate end, Scheme scheme) throws ConcurrentPeriodException
      Starts a new AccountingPeriod using a specific accounting Scheme. There will no exception raised in case the TransactionFilter is already part of the context.
      Parameters:
      start - the AccountingPeriod start date. Can be any date as long as it is before the end date.
      end - the AccountingPeriod start date. Can be any date as long as it is after the start date.
      scheme - the accounting Scheme to be used for the period.
      Returns:
      the initiated AccountingPeriod
      Throws:
      AccountingViolationException - when the end date is before the start date
      ConcurrentPeriodException - when attempting to start a new AccountingPeriod when there is another active.

    • addFilter

      void addFilter(TransactionFilter filter, int priority)
      Adds a TransactionFilter to the context. The filter will be added to the filtering chain of Transactions posted after this method call.
      Parameters:
      filter - the TransactionFilter to be added.
      priority - the priority to set on the TransactionFilter. The TransactionFilters with higher priority are executed first.

    • removeFilter

      void removeFilter(TransactionFilter filter)
      Removes a TransactionFilter from the context. The filter will not be present in the filtering chain of Transactions posted after this method call. There will no exception raised in case the TransactionFilter wasn't previously added to the context
      Parameters:
      filter - the TransactionFilter to be removed

    • addListener

      void addListener(TransactionListener listener)
      Adds a TransactionListener to the context. The Listener will receive notifications for all Transactions initiated after this method call. There will be no exception raised in case the TransactionListener was already added to the context.
      Parameters:
      listener - the TransactionListener to be added to the context.

    • removeListener

      void removeListener(TransactionListener listener)
      Removes a TransactionListener from the context. The Listener will no longer receive any notifications raised after this method call. There will be no exception raise in case the TransactionListener was not previously added to the context.
      Parameters:
      listener - the TransactionListener to be removed.
